column5: Hey Guys and Gals,  Just wondering if anyone is in the Dunnville area?  i want to head there this weekend but with the cold weather coming in I dont know if its a good idea.  Anybody know the water temp? or if the cats are in yet?  Its quite the trip for me so I dont want to go all the way there then find out theres nothing in the river yet  Thanks  Chuck
you could try giving steve at fishmasters bait a call, see what he has to say.

My Dad and I went just a little upstream from the Dunnville Dam on Saturday (for cats). The water was very high and fast (our usual spot was mostly underwater) . Not a bite using worms. Heavy sinkers kept our bait anchored, but the lines were catching a lot of weeds. Hopefully a week or 2 things will settle down.

I was out on Sunday,first run for the boat,Water temp 39 F current fast ,a lot of wood and logs.Keep a eye on the flow chart http://www.grandriver.ca/index/document.cfm?Sec=2&Sub1=6&Sub2=5 when it get around 200 it should be alright.Water temps around 45F is a good time to start.I'm there all of April so i will post when I start to get fish.
Sweet thanks for the info guys, looks like im not heading up this weekend, maybe next if the weather will start to get nicer
I had the same results as foggy I was out last weekend for cats in that area and nothing I would wait another week and you should get some better luck and the water will be lower hopefully.
